programme.title: Masjid Tiban
programme.desc: In a small village called Turen, in the south of the Malang Regency, in East Java Province of Indonesia, the Masjib Tiban, or Tiban mosque, is a religious site dating back several decades. Known for its striking physical appearance, the Mosque is an exten"& "ded complex that houses several other standing structures. This Mosque embraces the preservation of local customs as well as Islamic teaching. Indeed, the complex is also a boarding school that accommodates thousands of students.

programme.title: Christ Anglican Church
programme.desc: Christ Church is an Anglican church located in the town of Nazareth, Israel. Due to financial troubles the church couldn&apos t be completed by 1871 and lacked its intended spire, until one was finally added 143 years later, in 2014. Nearby lies the famous Ba"& "silica of the Annunciation.As of 2013 the church has about 40 families as members, and the membership is almost entirely Arab.

programme.title: Jakarta Old Town
programme.desc: We are in Jakarta,Indonesia one of the Old Town of the world heritage. And today shall take you around Jakarta Old Town, also known as Kota Tua. The old town of Jakarta is the cradle of Jakarta history. Of course, it started well before the Dutch arrived "& "and set up trading post. Dutch General named Jan Pieterszoon Coen conquered and razed the city in 1619. A walled township was established in 1650 in the name of Batavia. The capital of Dutch East Indies was established. None of the Dutch colonial cities h"& "as matched its grandeur and completeness. Our first halt will be historic Fatahillah Square, the original downtown area as it existed when Indonesia was a Dutch colony. Completed in 1650, and dubbed The Jewel of Asia, it was a planned city with churches"& ", public square, and canals.The historic buildings are surrounding the square. Which designed after Dutch colonial architecture. The most imposing building, the History Museum, is in the southern side of the Square. It is built in generous scale, with mas"& "sive timber beams and floorboards and has 37 ornate rooms. From being the administrative headquarter of the colonial administration to being a city hall and now museum, the building has a checkered history. Modeled after Royal Dutch Palace of Amsterdam, "& "with the dome copula, crowning the structure, you may recognize the central tower as typical 17th century Dutch city hall structure. In the center of the Square is the old Water Fountain. That Water Fountain used to supply water during colonial time and w"& "as restored to its original glory during 1970s. Now as we enter the Museum, we experience its fantastic collection of artifacts, more than 23,500 pieces, including maps, paintings, ceramic items and furniture related to Dutch East Indies Company. Also kno"& "wn as Fatahillah Museum, it houses the richest collection of Betawi style wooden furniture from 17th to 19th century and archeological items from the pre-historic era.

programme.title: Church of the Holy Sepulchre
programme.desc: A tour of the Church of the Holy Sepulcher, the heart of the holy city of Jerusalem. Located in the Christian quarter of Jerusalem, on a small narrow square, stuck between the houses of the old town, and at the foot of a minaret, the Church of the Holy Se"& "pulcher stands up at the end of Via Dolorosa...

programme.title: St. Joseph Church
programme.desc: A beautiful spot is in southern America, near the south coast of Brazil: we are in Belo Horizonte. Offering an oasis of peace in the middle of downtown Belo Horizonte's bustling life and busy traffic is the Saint Joseph Church, built by Dutch Redemptorist"& "s in the early 20th century.

programme.title: Sultan Amir Ahmad bathhouse, Iran
programme.desc: Sultan Amir Ahmad Bathhouse is one of oldest preserved Persian Hamman. It provides us with a glimpse of how things used to be in the past. It overwhelms us by its turquoise and gold heavens and amazes us with its beauty and unique architecture...

programme.title: Kazansky Female Monastery, Russia
programme.desc: An outstanding examples of 19th century Russian architecture, acomplex of four churches, one Cathedral, one chapel: The Kazan Female Monastery. Learn the story of its consecration, its ruin and revival.

programme.title: Wat Ratchathammaram, Thailand
programme.desc: Wat Ratchathammaram, also known as the small Wat Sila Ngu temple, is situated at the top of Hua Thanon beach in the south of Koh Samui, Thailand. Apart from Wat Sila Ngu, Wat Ratchathammaram is also called the Snake Stone temple.

programme.title: Cathedral of Christ the Saviour, Russia
programme.desc: One of the highest orthodox temples in the world, and the tallest Church in Moscow: the Cathedral of Christ the Savior. It wears its Russian-Byzantine style to tell its dramatic fate. It is a testimony of Russia's history.

programme.title: Coptic Church of the Annunciation, Israel
Goa Gajah
programme.desc: Goa Gajah, or Elephant Cave, is located on the island of Bali near Ubud, in Indonesia. Built in the 9th century, it served as a sanctuary. Although the exact origins of the cave are uncertain, it is believed to have been built as place for spiritual medit"& "ation. One folklore relates that it was created by the fingernail of the legendary giant Kebo Iwa. However, examining its style, the sanctuary was probably dated from the 11th century Bali Kingdom. The complex contains both Hindu and Buddhist imagery, as "& "the cave contains lingam and yoni, symbol of Shiva, and the image of Ganesha, while by the river there are carved images of stupas and chattra, imagery of Buddhism. The cave was rediscovered by Dutch archaeologists in 1923, but the fountains and bathing p"& "ool were not discovered until 1954.The temple is characterised by menacing faces that are carved into the stone whose purpose is assumed to be the warding off of evil spirits. The primary figure was once thought to be an elephant, hence the nickname Ele"& "phant Cave. Other sources state that it is named after the stone statue of the Hindu God Ganesh located inside of the temple. An extensive bathing place on the site was not excavated until the 1950s. The entrance of the cave is accessed only by walking do"& "wn a long flight of stairs. The inside of the temple is small and usually has trails of white smoke from the incense burning. Visitors wearing shorts will be issued a sarong to tie around the waist before entering the courtyard. The complex also contains "& "7 statues of women holding water pitchers that depicts seven holy rivers of India: the Ganga River, Sarasvati River, Yamuna River, Godavari River, Sindhu River, Kaveri River, and Narmada River.This site was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Tentative Lis"& "t on October 19, 1995, in the Cultural category, but was pulled out along with 11 other sites on 2015.

programme.title: Bosa Old town, Sardinia, Italy
programme.desc: The beautiful Bosa Old Town finds itself in Alghero To Oristano, an area strongly influenced by Spanish culture. The city is generally considered to have been founded in 1102. However, long before the Christian era, the Phoenicians set up a trading post on this exposed bay in western Sardinia.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration
programme.desc: This episode looks at the growing understanding of the Earth's complex climatic systems and the part on-orbit observation plays in the growth of knowledge about our planet.

programme.title: Trajectory
programme.desc: TO THE MOON - The Apollo program achieves its major objective. DRAGON, FALCON AND SPACEX - New directions in re-usable spacecraft. GAIA - Mapping our galaxy in unprecedented detail.

programme.title: Trajectory
programme.desc: THE BEGINNING OF THE END - After the first Moon landing the Apollo science program was about to start in earnest but people were losing interest. APOLLO GETS COMPLICATED - New technology is added that extends the reach of the Apollo program.

programme.title: Trajectory
programme.desc: THE SHUTTLE PROGRAM - The first re-useable spacecraft. THE CHALLENGER DISASTER - Pressing launch schedules lead to carelessness and the loss of the Challenger. RETURN TO SPACE - A re-designed shuttle is back in space with a redefined role.

programme.title: The New Frontier
programme.desc: Venus the first and brightest star in the evening sky, and Mercury fleeting across the solar disk. As we begin to take a closer look at our companions they are posing more questions than answers.

programme.title: The New Frontier
programme.desc: It has fired our imaginations for millennia, Mars, the God of War and the source of Man's science fictional demise. It is the only other place in our solar system than Man might one day call home.

programme.title: The New Frontier
programme.desc: From the beginnings of our Solar System four and half billion years ago there remains tantalizing clues to its evolution remnent debris: asteroids and comets. Now within our grasp these rocks of ice and dust are ready to give up their secrets.

programme.title: The New Frontier
programme.desc: Beyond the asteroid belt lay the ice giants, some can be seen with the naked eye, others only glimpsed once by a passing probe. We are again sending cameras to the edge of the solar system giving us new insights into the evolution of our worlds.

programme.title: Biomimicry
programme.desc: While we still have much to learn about the natural world, a new kind of science is coming to life, one which is adopting nature's most ingenious designs biomimicry! And it takes its first inspiration from bio-chemistry.

programme.title: Kalahari Meerkats
programme.desc: The rains have arrived, and the desert has never looked better. Cleo, the boss of this group of wild meerkats has given birth to five new pups, but some of them quickly get lost or snatched away. Only the toughest survive here in the African desert.

programme.title: Kalahari Meerkats
programme.desc: In another cruel twist, Cleo's young pup Ophelia got left behind on a foraging trip and was killed by one of the Kalahari's most dangerous creatures, a Goshawk. The remaining three pups: Zeus, Daisy and Flo struggle to survive.

programme.title: The Travel Bug
programme.desc: The first of a two-part special in Tahiti sees Morgan kicking things off in the capital, Papeete. It's quite a contrast to what you see in other parts of French Polynesia and many travellers never take the time to check it out.

programme.title: The Travel Bug
programme.desc: In part 2 of Morgan's Tahitian adventure, he visits the spectacular islands of Huahine and Rangiroa. They're two of the most idyllic Pacific paradises you'll come across and the sorts of places most travellers dream of someday visiting.

programme.title: Quolls: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Explore the life and habits of the elusive northern subspecies of the spotted-tailed quoll. Come with us on a journey into the personal life of this beautiful but endangered creature, a long-lost cousin of the Tasmanian tiger.

programme.title: The Lembeh Strait Walking Fish
programme.desc: Travel to the narrow strait between North Sulawesi and the island of Lembeh in Indonesia and discover one of the global hot spots of biodiversity and where fish are found to walk!

programme.title: Man vs. Wild
programme.desc: Bear is in the Sahara where he gets creative while finding water. He treks to the coast, catches an octopus and eats a stomach-turning bug burger of locusts and moths.

programme.title: OMG! Unavugal Aayiram!
programme.desc: Jason French takes Roger to Big Table Farm in Gaston to see a smoker built from a sea buoy. Later, they cook chicken and pork belly for a sunset feast.

programme.title: Food Factory
programme.desc: The host explores how cherry cordial bonbons come packed with explosive flavors and how a carefully selected batch of dried beans is combined to create a four-blend medley.

programme.desc: The competitors replace basket ingredients with a roll of the dice wherein round one features something slithery and a Vegas-themed item in round two is not a hit.

programme.title: Chutties Baking Championship
programme.desc: Young bakers prepare delicious recipes and compete against each other in a series of challenges to win the prestigious title.

programme.title: Man vs. Wild
programme.desc: Bear Grylls travels to Arizona, land of the Apache, and showcases how to survive in its 100,000 square miles of scorching deserts and freezing mountains.
